Title: Mrs. Miniver
Cast: Greer Garson, Walter Pidgeon, Teresa Wright, Dame May Whitty, Reginald Owen, Henry Travers, Richard Ney, Henry Wilcoxon, Christopher Severn, Brenda Forbes, Clare Sandars, Marie De Becker, Helmut Dantine, John Abbott, Connie Leon
Plot: A British family struggles to survive the first months of World War II. The Minivers, an English "middle-class" family experience life in the first months of World War II. While dodging bombs, the Minivers' son courts Lady Beldon's granddaughter. A rose is named after Mrs. Miniver and entered in the competition against Lady Beldon's rose. Written by Michael Rice <TheMikeRic@aol.com>
Keywords: rose, middle class, air raid, dunkirk, england
Location: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer Studios - 10202 W. Washington Blvd., Culver City, California, USA
Actors: Greer Garson, Walter Pidgeon, Teresa Wright
Writer: Arthur Wimperis (screenplay), George Froeschel (screenplay) | 3 more credits »
Description: Directed by William Wyler.  With Greer Garson, Walter Pidgeon, Teresa Wright, Dame May Whitty. A British family struggles to survive the first months of World War II.
